StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ConquestTitle
StringTable.String: Conquest Victory

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ConquestDec
StringTable.String: A Conquest Victory is achieved by destroying all other major civilizations.[BR][BR]Check victory progress under the Victory Status screen, accessible from the pause menu.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_InfluenceTitle
StringTable.String: Influence Victory

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_InfluenceDec
StringTable.String: An Influence Victory is achieved by having a majority of the galaxy in the Zone of Control and being at piece with all other major civlizations for several months.[BR][BR]Check victory progress under the Victory Status screen, accessible from the pause menu.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AllianceTitle
StringTable.String: Alliance Victory

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AllianceDec
StringTable.String: An Alliance Victory is achieved by being allied with all other major civilizations.[BR][BR]Check victory progress under the Victory Status screen, accessible from the pause menu.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PrestigeTitle
StringTable.String: Prestige Victory

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PrestigeDec
StringTable.String: A Prestige Victory is achieved by reaching a specific [HS=HS_Prestige]Prestige[/HS] Score.[BR][BR]Check victory progress under the Victory Status screen, accessible from the pause menu.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ZoneOfControlTitle
StringTable.String: Zone of Control

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ZoneOfControlDec
StringTable.String: The Zone of Control marks where a civilization's Influence extends to and is dominant. The Zone of Control is represented by shading the galaxy, the dominant Civilization's color. Multiple Civilizations may have Influence over a cell, but the Civilization with the highest Influence in the cell will be granted the cell.[BR][BR]Some actions are affected by the Zone of Control. Specific actions like mining asteroids can only be performed on objects within the Zone of Control. Other actions, like building Starbases, that can be performed outside the Zone of Control can not be performed in other Civilizations' Zone of Control.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_TileTitle
StringTable.String: Tile

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_TileDec
StringTable.String: The game space is divided into hexagonal Tiles. Distance is measured by the number of Tiles between locations. The grid of Tiles can be turned on and off in the Options Menu under Interface. Toggling Show Grid When Close and Show Grid When Far will set whether tiles are visible at certain zoom distances.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MonthsTitle
StringTable.String: Months

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MonthsDec
StringTable.String: Every game occurs in turns. A Month measures the amount of time between turns. A month passes after every Civilization has taken its turn.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MovesTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=Moves_Icon] Κινήσεις

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MovesDec
StringTable.String: Every Ship and Fleet has a set amount of [ICON=Moves_Icon] Moves. [ICON=Moves_Icon] Moves are the number of [HS=HS_Tile]Tiles[/HS] the Ship or Fleet can traverse in a [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS].[BR][BR]

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ShipTitle
StringTable.String: Ship

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ShipDec
StringTable.String: A ship is any individual mobile unit.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_FleetTitle
StringTable.String: Fleet

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_FleetDec
StringTable.String: A Fleet is a group of [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS]. Fleets can be formed by [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Moving[/HS] [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] onto the same [HS=HS_Tile]Tile[/HS]. How many [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] can be in a Fleet is determined by the current [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS]. Each [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] has a [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS] value and will add to the current Fleet's [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS] score. If a [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] has a higher [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS] score than the Fleet can incorporate, it will be unable to join the Fleet.[BR][BR]Utilizing Fleets is vital to survival. Groups of [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] do better in combat than individual [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ShipMovementTitle
StringTable.String: Ship Movement

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ShipMovementDec
StringTable.String: Individual [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] and [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] can be moved around the galaxy by selecting the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] or [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] with the LEFT Mouse Button and then designating a [HS=HS_Tile]Tile[/HS] to move to with the RIGHT Mouse Button.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PlanetTypeTitle
StringTable.String: Planet Type

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PlanetTypeDec
StringTable.String: Planet Type is the classification of a planet's biome and general environment. Different Planet Types often have different terrains in different amounts, determining what resources the planet can provide.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PlanetClassTitle
StringTable.String: Planet Class

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PlanetClassDec
StringTable.String: Planet Class is a measurement of the habitable space of a planet. Any planet with a Planet Class of 1 or greater can be [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS]. The higher the Planet Class, the more space there is for development. Planets with a higher Planet Class generally provide more resources than planets of a lower Planet Class of the identical [HS=HS_PlanetType]Planet Type[/HS].[BR][BR]Planets with a Planet Class of 0 are considered a [HS=HS_DeadWorld]Dead World[/HS] and can not be colonized.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_DeadWorldTitle
StringTable.String: Dead World

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_DeadWorldDec
StringTable.String: A Dead World is any planet with a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] of 0. Dead Worlds can not be colonized.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ColinizingTitle
StringTable.String: Colonizing

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ColinizingDec
StringTable.String: Colonizing new worlds is essential to expand a Civilization's [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS] and gaining access to more resources. Planets can only be [HS=HS_ColonizeOrder]Colonized[/HS] if there is no claim to the planet. Once a Planet is Colonized, it is claimed by the Colonizing Civilization. [BR][BR]A Planet must have a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] 1 or greater to be Colonized. Planets with a Planet Class of 0 are considered a [HS=HS_DeadWorld]Dead World[/HS] and can not be colonized.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ColonizeOrderTitle
StringTable.String: Colonize Order

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ColonizeOrderDec
StringTable.String: Colony Ships can be used to [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] new worlds. To [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] a planet, first, select the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] with the LEFT Mouse Button. With the appropriate [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] selected, order the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] to [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] to a planet with a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] of 1 or greater with the RIGHT Mouse Button. It may take several [HS=HS_Months]Months[/HS], but once the Colony Ship reaches the planet, it will colonize it tktkif abletktk.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_SurveyOrderTitle
StringTable.String: Survey Order

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_SurveyOrderDec
StringTable.String: The galaxy is often filled with [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS] that can be Surveyed by a [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ship[/HS]. To order a [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] to Survey an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS], begin by selecting the [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ship[/HS] with the LEFT Mouse Button. Then order the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] to [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] to the [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] location. Once the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] arrives at its destination, it will begin to Survey the [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS]. Surveying takes several [HS=HS_Months]Months[/HS].[BR][BR]A ship that is moved, attacked, or otherwise interrupted will lose all progress, and the Survey will need to start from the start.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AttackOrderTitle
StringTable.String: Attack Order

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AttackOrderDec
StringTable.String: There are many threats in the galaxy, and often offensive actions must be taken. [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] and [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] that have weapons can Attack other entities. To order an Attack, select the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] or [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] with the LEFT Mouse Button. Then order the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] or [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] to [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] to the target's location with the RIGHT Mouse Button. Once the destination is reached, combat will begin.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AutoExploreTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=AutoExplore_Icon] Auto-Explore

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AutoExploreDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=AutoExplore_Icon] Auto-Explore is an option that will set [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] to move without direct orders. [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] in [ICON=AutoExplore_Icon] Auto-Explore will move to destinations that are currently unknown and uncharted.[BR][BR]If the entire galaxy is explored and there are no uncharted [HS=HS_Tile]Tiles[/HS], the [ICON=AutoExplore_Icon] Auto-Explore option will become unavailable.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AutoSurveyTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=AutoSurvey_Icon] Auto-Survey

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AutoSurveyDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=AutoSurvey_Icon] Η Αυτόματη Έρευνα είναι διαθέσιμη μόνο σε [HS=HS_Ship]Πλοία[/HS] με Ενότητες Έρευνας. Ένα [HS=HS_Ship]Πλοίο[/HS] σε [ICON=AutoSurvey_Icon] Λειτουργία Αυτόματης Έρευνας θα κινείται χωρίς άμεσες εντολές, προσπαθώντας να εντοπίσει [HS=HS_Anomaly]Ανωμαλίες[/HS]. Όταν ένα [HS=HS_Ship]Πλοίο[/HS] σε [ICON=AutoSurvey_Icon] Λειτουργία Αυτόματης Έρευνας είναι κοντά σε μια [HS=HS_Anomaly]Ανωμαλία[/HS], θα [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Ερευνήσει[/HS] την [HS=HS_Anomaly ]Ανωμαλία[/HS] χωρίς άμεσες εντολές.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AutoColonizeTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=AutoColonize_Icon] Auto-Colonize

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AutoColonizeDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=AutoColonize_Icon] Auto-Colonize is only available to ships that can [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] a planet. A [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] in [ICON=AutoColonize_Icon] Auto-Colonize mode will move without direct orders, trying to locate planets with a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] of 1 or greater. When a planet is found, the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] will [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] the planet without direct orders.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AutoMineTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=AutoMine_Icon] Auto-Mine

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AutoMineDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=AutoMine_Icon] Auto-Mine is an option for Asteroid Mining ships. A [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] in [ICON=AutoMine_Icon] Auto-Mine will move without direct orders to try and find Asteroids within the [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS] to mine.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_SectorTitle
StringTable.String: Sector

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_SectorDec
StringTable.String: A Sector is an area of the Galaxy where Stars Systems are grouped together and can be traversed without specialized [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_LeaderMenuTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] Μενού Ηγετών

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_LeaderMenuDec
StringTable.String: The [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] Leaders Menu is where [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be recruited and managed. Under the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] Leaders Menu, there are screens for [HS=HS_RecruitmentScreen]Recruitment[/HS], [HS=HS_MinistersScreen]Ministers[/HS], [HS=HS_GovernorsScreen]Governors[/HS], [HS=HS_DiplomatsScreen]Diplomats[/HS], [HS=HS_CommandersScreen]Commanders[/HS], and [HS=HS_FactionsScreen]Factions[/HS].[BR][BR]Access the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] Leaders Menu by selecting the icon on the Radial Menu with the LEFT Mouse Button.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_RecruitmentScreenTitle
StringTable.String: Recruitment Screen

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_RecruitmentScreenDec
StringTable.String: The Recruitment Screen can be accessed through the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS]. Potential [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] will appear under the Recruitment Screen, where they can be assessed and hired.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MinistersScreenTitle
StringTable.String: Ministers Screen

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MinistersScreenDec
StringTable.String: The Ministers Screen can be accessed through the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS]. Minister Offices provide specific benefits to the whole Civilization based on the stats of the installed [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS]. Minister Offices without a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] assigned provide no benefits. Hovering the Mouse over an office will provide specific information about the office and its benefits.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be assigned, unassigned, and reassigned at any point during your turn.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_GovernorsScreenTitle
StringTable.String: Governors Screen

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_GovernorsScreenDec
StringTable.String: The Governors Screen can be accessed through the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS]. The Governors Screen briefly overviews every colonized planet with a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] of 10 or greater. If there is a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] assigned to the planet, the planet is a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be assigned, unassigned, and reassigned at any point during your turn.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_DiplomatsScreenTitle
StringTable.String: Diplomats Screen

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_DiplomatsScreenDec
StringTable.String: The Diplomats Screen can be accessed through the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS]. The Diplomat Screen briefly overviews our relationship with all other known Civilizations. [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] can be assigned as [HS=HS_Diplomat]Diplomats[/HS] to affect your relationship with other Civilizations.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be assigned, unassigned, and reassigned at any point during your turn.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CommandersScreenTitle
StringTable.String: Commanders Screen

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CommandersScreenDec
StringTable.String: The Commanders Screen can be accessed through the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS]. The Commanders Screen displays all Command Ships available to the Civilization. Command Ships can be deployed by assigning a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] to the ship.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_FactionsScreenTitle
StringTable.String: Factions Screen

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_FactionsScreenDec
StringTable.String: The Factions Screen can be accessed through the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS]. Factions are groups within a Civilization that affect specific stats and resources. Assigning a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] to a Faction causes the effects to change. More than one [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] can be assigned to a faction.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be assigned, unassigned, and reassigned at any point during your turn.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CivilizationMenuTitle
StringTable.String: Civilization Menu

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CivilizationMenuDec
StringTable.String: The [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] Civilization Menu provides an overview of your entire Civilization and a few tools to manage your Civilization on a larger scale. In the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] Civilization Menu, the [HS=HS_Taxes]Tax Rate[/HS] and [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] can be set.[BR][BR]Access the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] Civilization Menu by selecting the icon on the Radial Menu with the LEFT Mouse Button.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_SupportingColoniesTitle
StringTable.String: Supporting Colonies

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_SupportingColoniesDec
StringTable.String: A Supporting Colony is any [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS] planet that isn't a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. A Supporting Colony sends resources to the nearest [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] as Input, increasing the [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World's[/HS] Planetary Input to improve the planet's Output.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MineralsTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=RaceTraitEconomical] Γεννημένος Προμηθέας

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MineralsDec
StringTable.String: Minerals are the raw materials available to a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. Minerals are an Input that affects [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS]. The more Minerals a planet has as Input, the higher its [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] rating.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_TechnologyTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=RaceTraitEconomical] Εφευρετικός

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_TechnologyDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=Stat_Technology_Icon] Technology measures intellectual development available to a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. [ICON=Stat_Technology_Icon] Technology is an Input that affects [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS]. The more [ICON=Stat_Technology_Icon] Technology a planet has as Input, the higher its [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS] rating.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_FarmingTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=RaceTraitEconomical] Γεννημένος Προμηθεύς

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_FarmingDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=Stat_Fertility_Icon] Farming measures the resources agriculture produces available to a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. [ICON=Stat_Fertility_Icon] Farming is an Input that affects [ICON=Stat_Food_Icon] [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS]. The more [ICON=Stat_Fertility_Icon] Farming a planet has as Input, the more [ICON=Stat_Food_Icon] [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS] the [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] produces.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CultureTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=RaceTraitEconomical] Γεννημένος Προμηθέας

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CultureDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=Stat_PlanetInfluence_Icon] Culture measures the social significance available to a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. [ICON=Stat_PlanetInfluence_Icon] Culture is an Input that affects [ICON=Stat_Influence_Icon] [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS]. The more [ICON=Stat_PlanetInfluence_Icon] Culture a planet has as Input, the higher its [ICON=Stat_Influence_Icon] [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS] rating.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_WealthTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=Stat_Wealth_Icon] Wealth

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_WealthDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=Stat_Wealth_Icon] Wealth is the rare and precious materials available to a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. [ICON=Stat_Wealth_Icon] Wealth is an Input that affects [ICON=Stat_Income_Icon] [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS]. The more [ICON=Stat_Wealth_Icon] Wealth a planet has as Input, the more [ICON=Stat_Income_Icon] [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS] it produces.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ResearchCenterTitle
StringTable.String: Research Center

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ResearchCenterDec
StringTable.String: The Research Center is a menu that provides an overview of [HS=HS_Tech]Techs[/HS] being researched and allows you to change what [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] is being researched at any time during your turn. The rate at which [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] is researched is measured in [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS] and determined by your Civilizaton's [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS]. At the start of a turn, if a [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] is completed being Researched, you'll gain access to the Unlocks and have to designate a new [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] to research.[BR][BR]Select a [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] to research with the LEFT Mouse Button. The currently [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] being researched is always displayed in the bottom central panel.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_TechTitle
StringTable.String: Tech

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_TechDec
StringTable.String: A Tech is an option at the [HS=HS_ResearchCenter]Research Center[/HS] that, when Researched, will provide distinct Unlocks that can be new [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS], [HS=HS_Improvement]Improvements[/HS], [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Orders[/HS] and more.[BR][BR]Learn more about what a Tech unlocks by hovering the Mouse over the Tech in the [HS=HS_ResearchCenter]Research Center[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PiratesTitle
StringTable.String: Pirates

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PiratesDec
StringTable.String: Pirates are rogue [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS], [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS], and planets. By default, Pirates are hostile to all other groups and Civilizations. They can and will engage ships in combat, especially if they think they'll win the fight.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ShipyardTitle
StringTable.String: Shipyard

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ShipyardDec
StringTable.String: A Shipyard is where new [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] can be constructed. Shipyards require a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] to operate and can only be built from [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_RushTitle
StringTable.String: Rush

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_RushDec
StringTable.String: The Rush option allows you to spend [ICON=Stat_Credits_Icon][HS=HS_Credit]Credits[/HS] and [ICON=Stat_Control_Icon] [HS=HS_Control]Control[/HS] to reduce the time to complete a construction to 1 [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS]. A Rushed construction always moves to the front of the Queue. The Rush option can only be used once per turn on each [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] and [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PlanetManagementTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=Menu_PlanetManagement_Icon] Παράθυρο Διαχείρισης Πλανήτη

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PlanetManagementDec
StringTable.String: The [ICON=Menu_PlanetManagement_Icon] Planet Management Window is where you can manage your [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS]. You can get detailed breakdowns of the planet's Input and Output along with the status of the planet. You can also construct and deconstruct [HS=HS_Improvement]Improvements[/HS] along with managing Projects.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AdjacencyTitle
StringTable.String: Adjacency Bonus

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AdjacencyDec
StringTable.String: The Adjacency Bonus applies to [HS=HS_Improvement]Improvements[/HS] built next to each other. To maximize efficiency, it's best to construct similar [HS=HS_Improvement]Improvements[/HS] in adjacent tiles to boost their bonus.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ConstructStarbaseTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=Order_ConstructStarbase] Κατασκευή Αστρικής Βάσης

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ConstructStarbaseDec
StringTable.String: The Construct Starbase order can be given to [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructor[/HS]. This will consume the [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructor[/HS] and create a [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS] of a chosen type. [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] can not be constructed in another player's [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS] or within 3 [HS=HS_Tile]Tiles[/HS] of another [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_StarbaseTitle
StringTable.String: Starbases

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_StarbaseDec
StringTable.String: A Starbase is a specialized immobile construction that can serve a variety of roles, depending on where and how it is built. To build a Starbase, produce a [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructor[/HS] from a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS]. A Constructor can then be given the [HS=HS_ConstructStarbase]Construct Starbase[/HS] command to create a Starbase at its current location.[BR][BR]There are four types of Starbases: [ICON=Icon_MilitaryStarbase] [HS=HS_MilitaryStarbase]Military[/HS], [ICON=Icon_MiningStarbase] [HS=HS_MininingStarbase]Mining[/HS], [ICON=Icon_EconomicsStarbase] [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic[/HS], and [ICON=Icon_MiningStarbase] [HS=HS_CommunicationsStarbase]Communication[/HS]. The types available when using the [HS=HS_ConstructStarbase]Construct Starbase [/HS] depends on the resources within the [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructor's[/HS] area of effect.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MilitaryStarbaseTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=Icon_MilitaryStarbase] Στρατιωτική Αστρική Βάση

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MilitaryStarbaseDec
StringTable.String: Dedicates Starbase to protecting your Civilization and its assets

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MiningStarbaseTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=Icon_MiningStarbase] Αστρική Βάση Εξόρυξης

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MiningStarbaseDec
StringTable.String: Dedicates Starbase to mining nearby [HS=HS_StrategicResource]Strategic Resources[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CommunicationsStarbaseTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=Icon_CommunicationsStarbase] Σταθμός Επικοινωνιών Άστρων

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CommunicationsStarbaseDec
StringTable.String: Dedicates Starbase to extending your cultural Influence and assets.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_EconomicsStarbaseTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=Icon_EconomicsStarbase] Οικονομική Αστροβάση

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_EconomicsStarbaseDec
StringTable.String: Dedicates Starbase to building up the economy of your Core Worlds.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ConqueringPlanetsTitle
StringTable.String: [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Conquering Planets

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ConqueringPlanetsDec
StringTable.String: All colonized planets have a [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Planetary Conquest rating. This represents how defended a planet is and how much military might it will take to overcome its defenses. [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] have a Conquest Rating, representing how equipped they are to besiege a planet. Some ships, like Transport ships, are better equipped to Conquer planets than others.[BR][BR]To initiate a siege, issue a [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] command to a [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] with the target being the Planet to conquer. When the [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] reaches the Planet, it will initiate a siege if its [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Conquest Rating is high enough to overcome the Planet's [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Conquest Rating.
